definition: overseas Chinese/(in a restricted sense) Chinese emigrant who still retains Chinese nationality/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]

definition: Chinese person who returns to China after living as an expatriate
family members of nationals residing abroad
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
foreign concession, an enclave occupied by a foreign power (in China in the 19th and 20th centuries)
Vietnamese resident in other countries (including in China)
